intro: Tinnea fuscoluteola, commonly known as the brown-flowered tinnea, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to brown. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture. Tinnea fuscoluteola is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
